conclusion: Area of coil ABCO = 0.4 m², Magnetic induction intensity B = 0.1 T, Coil rotates 60° downward around the z-axis
The magnetic flux Φ through a coil is given by Φ = B · A · cos(θ)
The coil ABCO lies in the xz-plane with normal vector pointing along the y-axis
Initial flux Φ₁ = B · A · cos(90°) = 0.1 T · 0.4 m² · 0 = 0 Wb
After rotation, the normal vector makes an angle of 30° with the x-axis
Final flux Φ₂ = B · A · cos(30°) = 0.1 T · 0.4 m² · 0.866 = 0.03464 Wb
Change in flux = Φ₂ - Φ₁ = 0.03464 Wb - 0 Wb = 0.03464 Wb
The change in magnetic flux through the coil is 0.0346 Wb
